reviews.text: Great spot to sit outside and enjoy amazing spring weather. Surrounded by shops and cafes on the one side and across from the flag of Kyrgyzstan. It’s a good area to watch the changing of the guard at the top of the hour. Also a short walk from several other amazing parks.

Nice and cozy place where you can enjoy seeing both White House and National Museum. There are benches where you can sit but usually they are occupied on holidays. There is also a big Kyrgyz flag hanging on the pole and two guardians protecting it. There are also fountains and flowers where you can have a photo. There is also the statue of a national hero Manas. Nice place to get familiar with the history of the country and see local people.
A must visit while in Bishkek. It is the main square with the kyrgyzstan flag and over looking a quite beautiful government building
Nice place to visit really. The park is very greeny and beautiful

Ala too square is located in the middle of the Bishkek with fantastic views to capture for photography lovers

Try to visit before 4pm as they don’t have a good lighting for all try buildings and will be a hard task to walk around as it will be super cool with breeze 

Roads and floor will be slippery so take care with your foots and always try to use boots 🥾 which will be the safest 

Get some good landscapes with snow ❄️

This museum was great. I was here for a summer program and stopped by. It was great. Very informative, interesting exhibits about Greece and stuff. Interesting to see the old congress area. The artwork was neat and the place really made an impact on me.

Not friendly to non Greek due to the lack of guidance and proper text explanations. If you are Greek and well educated in terms of modern greek history then it works. But overall it is old style museum. In any case, with only 3 euros of entry fee, it is worth visiting.
What a gem in the middle of Athens! For anyone to get a wonderful exposure to Greece's history from 1821 to-date, this is a MUST visit! Enjoy!

Museum has a unique collection of items from the war for independence. Is not big, but very interesting. Impressive building. Sundays entrance is free. But working hours are not for the visitors just if you are early bird you can catch it. Sorry but this must be changed as you are public place.

Interesting artifacts with some English descriptions. Difficult to understand the significance without a thorough knowledge of contemporary Greek history. Not recommended for foreign tourists. Tons of school groups, very distracting from the experience.
It is the highest wooden orthodox church worldwide as far as I know. Very beautiful place for sightseeing and pray
Will be better when the scaffolding is removed

Really nice and peaceful Orthodox cathedral in downtown Almaty. The interior and the exterior are beautifully decorated. After visiting the cathedral, be sure to spend some time going around the surrounding park, which is beautiful as well and makes for a very pleasant walk.
Good place for evening walking in hot summer days.
Good place , feel mind free
İnteresting museum. İf you know little about Frunze its better to go there after some research about him. İt will make easier to understand the museum.

One of the best museum in Bishkek. It dedicated to the hero of Russian Civil war, which took place in the beginning of XX century after the Great October Socialist revolution - Michail Frunze. The three stories museum has been built outside the old house of Michail Frunze where he was born
Huge building with a lot of Soviets artifacts. Must visit for any who interested in history. Some exhibits have english translation.
You must visit the museum very nice feeling you will feel like you where there at that time you can see the house and every details how it was.... I just can say wow
Good place to see Russian and Kyrgyz history by evidences
Most of the things showed were not translated in English and the workers would not stop looking and following. 50 soms for locals and 100 soms for foreigners, I don’t know what for.
The best solyanka soup I ever tasted!
Clean, cheap and tasty. They work till midnight. Mostly Uigur cuisine, shivh means langman, ganfan, beef with veggies. Perfect when you really want to eat something tasty but everywhere is closed :)
One of the best lagmans served in the city! Cooked in front of you fresh! The homemade desserts after meal  mindblowing!
Cheap, tide, tasty food. What else you need?!
Fast, delicious and warm welcome from the staff
Nice atmosphere and music. Food and drinks were really  good and they have rich menu. Prices are acceptable

Staff speaks only Russian (neither English or Kyrgyz). Food is okay but it's too little for a grown man. It's half the size of "regular" portions in other similar places. I would call this place pricey. On the positive side, the outdoor seating is good.

A good restaurant with a good reputation in central Bishkek. Just on the side of the Russian Drama Theater named after Chingiz Aitmatov. Good pizza and good beer. Great Spring, Summer and early Autumn outdoor area. Warm and cozy inside in the Winter.
My lovely place..
Great food, specific atmosphere, mediocre service.
The food is really tasty and the crew provides a really good service. Started with a salad, soup and a pizza! Its really great, would recommend to those craving for some italian cuisine.
Probably the best Italian restaurant in the town. Lacks some dishes but the quality of the food is awesome. Liked the interior after renovation. Good wines selection and fresh baked bread.
In general good cuisine. Very good cheescake.
Best Italian food in Bishkek. Pizza are ok but pasta is delicious!
The food was very good, just the service is a bit slow.

We arrived early afternoon and asked to sit inside, there were maybe 2 guests in whole establishment. The waitress told us not possible as reserved tables, we left after food and there were still just 2 guests.
What is also poor is my friends food arrived 15 minutes before mine, she had almost finished eating before my meal arrived. How difficult for even a basic student chef or cook to start for example a steak, which takes twice time as salmon for example so both meals arrive same time. 
So not good experience and do not recommend. 
Shame as food was nice. 
Let down by poor service
It's awesome for party
One of the best lounge bars in Bishkek.
Great cocktails.

Ооо это то самое место где все как и надо. Особая атмосфера.  Вкусные блюда . Суперский кальян . А глинтвейн который я пила мне показался просто шикарным,терпким. Согревающее то что нужно в весеннее и осенние  дни. Если вы не пьющий человек. Самое то. И официанты так ненавязчиво готовы предложить все о чем вы подумали) одно из любимых мест
Very slow survice and they don't event clean up the table. I'm disappointed. Also, you're waiting for food for minimum 20 minutes.
There are definitely better Chinese restaurants in Bishkek
Very very tasty but not comfortable
Good menu and service
Better than old
Historical Burana towers. Great scenery but climbing on the tower is difficult due to narrow staircase

Ancient tower, 80 km from Bishkek. Reveals all the steppe beauty. 
60 soms for that. There are small museum and souvenir shop near the tower. You can observe ancient coins, stone writings, swords etc. in museum. 

In the second picture you can see field of balbals - stone faces, warriors, women.

Not much to see here but an old broken tower. They have a spiral ladder to go up to a hallway which lead to the entrance of the tower. You have to crawl inside a small corridor to go up the the top. From here you can see a very nice view around(again not much to see) 
The stoneheads around the area are interesting but not something phenomenal. 
Also interesting are the stone money they have laying around.
Good roasted chicken is awesome view too
One of the best historical sights you must to visit in Kyrgyzstan
